text: Pseudobagarius meridionalis is a species of catfish belonging to the family Akysidae (the stream catfishes). It is only known from the Barito River basin in southern Borneo. This is a very small catfish, up to 32 mm standard length, with a body dark brown above with a few scattered pale spots and white below, with a strongly projected upper jaw so that the premaxillary teeth are clearly visible even when the mouth is closed. ==References== * * Category:Akysidae Category:Freshwater fish of Indonesia Category:Fish described in 2004 Category:Endemic fauna of Indonesia Category:Fauna of Borneo
title: Pseudobagarius meridionalis
